alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 3:04PM MST until August 25 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Navajo County in north central Arizona... Western Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 304 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the near Indian Wells. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Keams Canyon, Cedar Springs, Tees Toh, Dilkon, Seba Dalkai, Castle Butte, Indian Wells, White Cone, Jeddito, Jadito, Navajo, Hopi Reservation and Navajo Reservation. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
